text:
Allow me to frame this issue with an analogy: Imagine established beliefs in the psych industry as a series of incorrect beliefs built on top of one another like a totem pole.

Every new form of deviance adds a totem, while the neurodiversity movement knocks one down.
user_description: (He/Him) ‚ôø #ActuallyAutistic/#ADHD ‚àû | Anarchist ‚í∂ (AnCom) | Absurdist | Xenoblade fanboy | Anarchism is when you say you support equality and actually mean it.

text:
The more traction the neurodiversity movement receives, the more established beliefs and practices in the psych industry tend to fall apart.

It's becoming ever more clear that the psych industry is first and foremost a tool of social conformity, rather than a legitimate science.
user_description: (He/Him) ‚ôø #ActuallyAutistic/#ADHD ‚àû | Anarchist ‚í∂ (AnCom) | Absurdist | Xenoblade fanboy | Anarchism is when you say you support equality and actually mean it.

text:
The neurodiversity movement is slowly but surely shifting the paradigm with regards to this issue.

We've come to understand that many forms of neurodivergence aren't actually mentally ill, we're merely different. We simply require social acceptance and accommodations.

Ever heard of the term Neurodiversity?

It means that no two brains function in the same manner.

Some common examples of neurodiversity would be people with:
-ADHD
-Autism
-Dyslexia

They add unique and different perspectives to a community and must not be seen as deficits.

text:

text: These groups can provide a safe space for individuals to connect with others who understand their experiences and can offer support and advice. Additionally, many adults with neurodiversity find success building connections through shared interests or hobbies.
One way to find people who understand and accept neurodiversity is by seeking out support groups or online communities for neurodiverse adults.

Making friends as an adult can be hard for anyone, but for those who are neurodiverse, the challenge can be even greater. Neurodiversity refers to the diversity of human brains and the different ways in which they function.

text:
Reminder since #Neurodiversity is trending:

A person in the neurological minority is *neurodivergent* - different from the majority (neurotypical people).

A group of people are *neurodiverse* - a variety of neurotypes, neurotypical AND neurodivergent.

These are not synonyms.
